description: Could be construed as either micro +‎ -tome (“instrument for cutting”) or micro- +‎ tome.

entries.meaning: A special instrument that produces very thin slices of plant and animal tissues, for later examination by light microscope or electron microscope.

verbs.description: microtome (third-person singular simple present microtomes, present participle microtoming, simple past and past participle microtomed)

entries.meaning: To cut into sections using a microtome
